title: This app just isn‚Äôt it.

I hate you, Instagram. Andrew Tate was my life, and you took that away from me.

Gone are the days of just checking in on your friends, family and favorite celebrities. Today, I scrolled through 12 suggested posts and 2 ads before I reached a single post from a page I actually follow and care about. I don‚Äôt want posts from pages I don‚Äôt follow. I try to carefully curate what is on my page, but with suggested posts and ads, I can‚Äôt. Instead of being sent funny or cool pictures from my friends, all I am sent is reels. I don‚Äôt want this. I miss the Instagram of 10 years ago. The fun, friendly, minimal ad platform that it once was. Now it‚Äôs just a cesspool of negativity and ads, just like it‚Äôs parent company, Facebook, which I deleted off of my devices in 2020. Now, 3 years later, I‚Äôm pulling the plug on Instagram. It‚Äôs a sad day, but my mental health will be better for deleting this sad app, a pathetic and depressing shell of what it once was. ‚úåüèª
